text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with a recap of the Kashan 5:55
event in San Francisco five pigs five
chefs five wineries and it started with
a VIP reception which was very nice
oyster bar cheese and $500 bottles of
Cabernet which is very nice ghost horse
veneers best wine I tasted all day and
then Brady Lowe from taste Network
addressed the VIPs so on 5x5 my pigs
five chefs five winemakers friendly
competition for a cause it's all about
promotion of heritage breed pigs and
farmers or and ranchers who are starting
these amazing gene lines of promoting
great diversity you guys are the
ambassador's of bringing this all
together so I wanted to say thank you
alright then I got a little sneak
preview I snuck into the room before it
was set up the chefs were getting ready
the gratuitous giant multimedia
presentation on the wall and the
Fairmont is up on Nob Hill San Francisco
beautiful views and then the room filled
up quickly with just hundreds of foodies
they had a butcher there who actually
broke down an entire Pig and of course
he could not resist the cheap attempt at
humor oh yeah
all right the woman behind him didn't
enjoy that anyway he broke that down
into every imaginable cut really
interesting to watch then we had these
chefs the stars of the show this was
Ryan fire who did some really nice food
they had corn dogs pork corn dogs of
course that they were deep-frying really
nice beer batter they also had thinly
sliced cured meat that they hung from
clothespins and these beautiful women
walked around and you pulled the meat
off very cool they also had a beautiful
sausage and beans a chicharones taco
which was fried pork skin stuffed with
pork and their dessert really
interesting a lard cookie pork fat
cookie the next chef was Nate Appleman
from a 16 and he did a whole roasted pig
sometimes simple as best in fact you
know what never mind
always simple as best so Nate just did a
whole roasted pig he dressed it with
some really simple teriyaki sauce it was
really good the crispy skin the
succulent meat come on he also had some
pork skin sushi very interesting then it

a prep plates for the judges which is
what he's doing right there this was a
Trotter cake that brioche there's made

some pork belly that was little
chocolate pudding also made with blood
believe it or not
all right then it was Robbie Kapur from
Boulevard they had some pork sliders a
freshly roasted leg of pork that they
were just slicing that beautiful juicy
meat that was back fat that was cured
served with padrone's peppers I don't
know if I like the texture was kind of
crunchy peter McNee did a really nice
selection of charcuterie items that is a
rolled pig had terrine with a cherry and
dandelion
tater tots I mean Trotter tots that's
pigs feet and a bunch of other parts
that they fried really good he had a
porchetta which is just a roast spit
roasted pork with beans amazingly
delicious and then at the end after all

yeah
